newsitem.title: USA: Argentine jobless rate worrisome - bank official.
newsitem.headline: Argentine jobless rate worrisome - bank official.

text.p: Although the Argentine economy is back on a growth path after four quarters of recession, the country's current high unemployment rate remains a concern, said Rodolfo Anibal Frigeri, Chairman of Banco de la Provincia de Buenos Aires.

Speaking at a conference sponsored by the Americas Society, Frigeri said, "We have fortunately in the last semester come out of the recession. It enables us to predict GDP (gross domestic product) of 3.0 percent." However, he noted that the country's current unemployment rate of 17.1 percent is "worrisome."
Frigeri said that while four percent of the current unemployment rate could be corrected, he noted that a drop in the remaining jobless rate would be a "lengthier process."
He also said the country needs to be efficient with social spending and that it must retrain people so they could reenter the job market.
Asked what would happen if the Argentine unemployment rate remained at the current high levels over the next year, Frigeri replied: "It would be worrisome."
